<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>Two important data points to update you on. The first? U.S. consumer spending </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-economy-losing-speed-as-year-winds-down-idUSKBN28X1MS?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a></span><span> for the first time since the spring in November. The second: Jobless claims for the last week came in at a still-extremely-high </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/ap-top-news-unemployment-coronavirus-pandemic-layoffs-economy-7fb2d64292d0ec938be86702d73bbe30?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">803,000</a></span><span>. These numbers show the economic recovery has hit a plateau.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Defense: </strong></span><span>President Trump is battling with Congress along multiple fronts. Yesterday, he </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-politics-defense-policy-bills-babbd8bbce66db1b1b28b0f4f3cb3f13?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vetoed</a></span><span> the annual defense policy bill that authorizes $740+ billion for military projects. Considering the bill’s overwhelming support on Capitol Hill, Congress could potentially override his veto. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More pardons: </strong></span><span>President Trump issued </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/23/us/politics/trump-pardon-manafort-stone.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">26 more pardons</a></span><span>, including former campaign chair Paul Manafort, adviser and friend Roger Stone, and Jared Kushner's father Charles Kushner. </span>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/pelosi-call-lastminute-session-stimulus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Second Stimulus Bill: 'The Irishman' of Legislation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nancy Pelosi doing a press conference about the economic stimulus" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTc3L25hbmN5X3BlbG9zaV9zdGltdWx1cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two hours in and we’re still watching De Niro contemplate his life and regrets. At 9am today, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/trump-threatens-covid-relief-pelosi-urges-sign-bill-74879887?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will call</a> a last-minute House session in which she will likely encourage Republicans to increase the direct payments in the economic stimulus bill passed Monday night from $600 to $2,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick refresher: </strong>Congress could learn a thing or two from Bobby D about offering things people can’t refuse. In a surprise video posted Tuesday night, President Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/president-trump-criticizes-stimulus-package-twitter-video?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared</a> his opposition to the stimulus package, demanding the payments be increased to $2,000 per person and that lawmakers remove the fluffier parts that don’t directly address the pandemic crisis. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Trump’s move effectively turned Congress upside down </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Democrats have backed Trump’s position, putting Republicans in the hot seat. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As Business Insider </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/lose-lose-mcconnell-as-trump-dems-support-2000-stimulus-checks-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">puts it</a></span><span>, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is in “a no-win situation.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He’s reportedly worried that if the payments are too measly, they could cost his party the Georgia runoff election in a few weeks—and with it, control of the Senate. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>The original package <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/23/politics/donald-trump-covid-relief-capitol-hill/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed with</a> a veto-proof majority, but members of the Republican party may back off if Trump whips out the veto pen. And in order for a House vote to happen today, Pelosi needs unanimous consent, which is tougher to come by on the Hill than a person who didn’t go to Georgetown. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Trump isn’t the stimulus package’s only critic </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some members of Congress have questioned the bill’s offbeat elements, including…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A provision making illegal streaming a felony </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A tax break for racehorse owners</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A declaration that China must not interfere with the selection of the next Dalai Lama </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, including GOP Sen. Ted Cruz and Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, criticized the bill for being rushed through Congress. But proponents—and there were lots: the bill passed 92–6 in the Senate—say it’s a critical lifeline for suffering Americans and businesses who need emergency aid ASAP. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The second stimulus package didn’t just provide Covid relief, it also funded the government. If more funding isn’t offered before Dec. 28, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-23/pelosi-plans-thursday-vote-on-trump-s-2-000-stimulus-checks?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we could see</a> a government shutdown.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LOGISTICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/vaccine-distribution-off-good-start-next-stages-wrapped-uncertainty?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine PEMDAS
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of yesterday, more than <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/23/covid-vaccine-us-has-vaccinated-1-million-people-out-of-goal-of-20-million-for-december.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1 million people</a> in the U.S. have received their first dose of a Covid-19 vaccine (you can let out a “yippee” if you want). Hospital staff and nursing home workers—unquestionably “essential” in the fight against the virus—have been the initial recipients of the doses. But deciding which workers should receive the vaccines <em>after</em> healthcare staff is a lot more complicated.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who else is “essential?” </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The definition gets murkier as workers in the delivery, manufacturing, agriculture, education, and services industries all jostle for the next wave of doses. And states that drafted their own distribution plans months ago are having trouble accommodating the CDC’s recent recommendations, which cover nearly <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vaccine-eligibilit/explainer-us-vaccine-rollouts-next-challenge-verifying-who-is-essential-idUSKBN28X1A2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">70% of the U.S. labor force</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For instance, Florida is telling the CDC to talk to the hand, deciding to </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/dd86f99e-bfe0-3037-af8b-9ad236e7da66?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vaccinate seniors</a></span><span> 65 or older before any other workers. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>while the order of vaccine operations remains ambiguous, one thing is clear: The U.S. wants a lot of doses. It just ordered an additional <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-pfizer/pfizer-u-s-strike-100-million-covid-19-vaccine-deal-with-70-million-due-by-june-idUSKBN28X1GC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 million</a> from Pfizer, pushing its total order of all vaccines to over 1 billion. </p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/new-jersey-joins-states-supporting-new-hampshire-lawsuit-taxing-outof-state-remote-workers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Live Free or Sue Massachusetts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, New Jersey <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/23/new-jersey-latest-state-to-join-supreme-court-battle-remote-worker-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became</a> the latest state to call on the Supreme Court to take up a case over income taxes—basically, deciding which state gets your $$$. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Certain places, like NYC and Omaha, NE, have typically welcomed a large proportion of workers who commute from <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/states-square-off-over-taxing-remote-workers-income-11608735600?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">out of state</a>. Seven states levied income taxes using the “convenience rule,” which means that a New Jersey resident who works in Manhattan pays New York income taxes, but gets a credit on their NJ bill to avoid double taxation. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Now, because of the pandemic, that NJ resident is probably working from home...leaving New Jersey to wonder why New York is getting all the tax revenue. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cue this actual bridge in New Jersey’s state capital, Trenton.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTgxL3RyZW50b25fYnJpZGdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Jag9889?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jag9889</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Lower_Trenton_Bridge_20091103-jag9889.jpg?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lower Trenton Bridge 20091103-jag9889</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In October, New Hampshire filed a lawsuit against Massachusetts to try and stop it from taxing NH residents who work remotely for companies based in Massachusetts. Connecticut, Hawaii, Iowa, and now New Jersey have also sided with Team NH. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> A<em> lot</em> of cash is at stake at a time when state coffers need it. New Jersey <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-23/new-jersey-challenges-new-york-tax-on-residents-working-remotely?utm_source=google&utm_medium=bd&cmpId=google&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credits</a> as much as $1.2 billion in revenue to residents who pay New York income taxes. </p>

</h3>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/roundup-christmastime-covid19-restrictions-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
<em>Is </em>It Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Christmas globe" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTc4L2NocmlzdG1hc19nbG9iZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We wrote a version of this story for Passover. Then Easter. Then Ramadan. Then July 4th. Then Labor Day. Then Thanksgiving. And we’re going to do it again for Christmas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know what sentence is coming next: The holiday is going to look a little different this year. The AP <a href="https://apnews.com/article/travel-brazil-italy-peru-lebanon-b7ed55cb8ba09b6295e3f078226dbcb3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rounded up</a> all the different Covid restrictions people around the globe are facing this holiday season, so here’s a roundup of that roundup: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The UK: </strong>People living in London and other areas in southeast England will be under the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/dec/23/millions-more-face-tier-4-covid-restrictions-in-england-from-boxing-day?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strictest “Tier 4” restrictions</a> in order to slow the spread of a new virus variant. Tier 4 prohibits households from mixing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Itay: </strong>From today through Dec. 27, all shops will have to close except food stores, pharmacies, and hairdressers. Newspapers are publishing colorful graphics to help people remember the rules.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lebanon: </strong>The economically struggling Middle Eastern nation is actually encouraging people to travel back to the country and spend money—it even opened nightclubs last week (but without dancing). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The U.S.: </strong>There are no specific Christmas-related Covid restrictions, however travel is expected to drop 29% this year, per AAA. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/clubhouse-launches-influencer-program?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Clubhouse Influencers Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Show me the money clip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=358 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9HQRIttS5C4Za/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Show me the money clip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9HQRIttS5C4Za/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The buzzy audio social media app Clubhouse, which lets users join virtual rooms to eavesdrop on other people’s conversations, just got even buzzier. According to the NYT, it’s been testing an invite-only <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/23/style/clubhouse-app-influencers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">private club</a> called Everything in Moderation.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">You’re probably not invited</strong></span><span>: Only around 40 of the app’s most popular creators are on the list, as Clubhouse tries to keep its power users happy and navigate the age-old problem of monetization. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Clubhouse, No. 14 on the App Store’s free app list, is hoping to avoid becoming the next Vine (RIP), which shut down in 2016 after 20 of its top 50 creators <a href="https://www.mic.com/articles/157977/inside-the-secret-meeting-that-changed-the-fate-of-vine-forever?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">left the app</a> a year earlier. The reason? Vine balked at the $1.2 million individual price tag the creators requested to retain them. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>History is repeating itself. During the first meeting between users and company leadership, one Clubhouse creator asked “Where’s the money at?” per the NYT.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Everything in Moderation influencer program is the beginning of Clubhouse’s answer.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Clubhouse better figure it out quickly because the vultures are circling; Twitter has been testing out a similar voice chat room feature called <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/17/22187490/twitter-spaces-test-voice-chat-rooms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spaces</a>.  </p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a fun game we invented last night.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Each song has a particular tempo, which can be measured in beats per minute, or BPM. Essentially, it’s how fast a song is. “Sandstorm” has a higher BPM than “Let’s Get It On.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So the quiz is this: We’ll give you two songs, and you have to determine the song with the higher BPM (aka higher tempo). </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Uptown Funk” by Bruno Mars</span><span><em> </em></span><span>or “Uptown Girl” by Billy Joel </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together” or “Bad Blood,” both by Taylor Swift  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney category: “Under the Sea” or “Hakuna Matata”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ed Sheeran’s “Shape of You” or Adele’s “Set Fire to the Rain” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Levels” by Avicii or “Bad Guy” by Billie Eilish (the first part)</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo important data points to update you on. U.S. consumer spending \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-economy-losing-speed-as-year-winds-down-idUSKBN28X1MS?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the first time since the spring in November. The second: Jobless claims for the last week came in at a still-extremely-high \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/ap-top-news-unemployment-coronavirus-pandemic-layoffs-economy-7fb2d64292d0ec938be86702d73bbe30?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e803,000\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. These numbers show the economic recovery has hit a plateau.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDefense: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump is battling with Congress along multiple fronts. Yesterday, he \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-politics-defense-policy-bills-babbd8bbce66db1b1b28b0f4f3cb3f13?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evetoed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the annual defense policy bill that authorizes $740+ billion for military projects. Considering the bill’s overwhelming support on Capitol Hill, Congress could potentially override his veto. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore pardons: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump issued \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/23/us/politics/trump-pardon-manafort-stone.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid Kushner's father Charles collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo hours in and we’re still watching De Niro contemplate his life and regrets. At 9am today, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/trump-threatens-covid-relief-pelosi-urges-sign-bill-74879887?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill call\u003c/a\u003e a last-minute House session in which she will likely encourage Republicans to increase the direct payments in the economic stimulus bill passed Monday night from $600 to $2,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuick refresher: \u003c/strong\u003eCongress could learn a thing or two from Bobby D about offering things people can’t refuse. In a surprise video posted Tuesday night, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/president-trump-criticizes-stimulus-package-twitter-video?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclared\u003c/a\u003e his opposition to the stimulus package, demanding the payments be increased to $2,000 per person and that lawmakers remove the fluffier parts that don’t directly address the pandemic crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTrump’s move effectively turned Congress upside down \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDemocrats have backed Trump’s position, putting Republicans in the hot seat. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs Business Insider \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lose-lose-mcconnell-as-trump-dems-support-2000-stimulus-checks-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eputs it\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is in “a no-win situation.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe’s reportedly worried that if the payments are too measly, they could cost his party the Georgia runoff election in a few weeks—and with it, control of the Senate. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eThe original package \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/23/politics/donald-trump-covid-relief-capitol-hill/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed with\u003c/a\u003e a veto-proof majority, but members of the Republican party may back off if Trump whips out the veto pen. And in order for a House vote to happen today, Pelosi needs unanimous consent, which is tougher to come by on the Hill than a person who didn’t go to Georgetown. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTrump isn’t the stimulus package’s only critic \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome members of Congress have questioned the bill’s offbeat elements, including…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA provision making illegal streaming a felony \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA tax break for racehorse owners\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA declaration that China must not interfere with the selection of the next Dalai Lama \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLawmakers on both sides of the aisle, including GOP Sen. Ted Cruz and Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, criticized the bill for being rushed through Congress. But proponents—and there were lots: the bill passed 92–6 in the Senate—say it’s a critical lifeline for suffering Americans and businesses who need emergency aid ASAP. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe second stimulus package didn’t just provide Covid relief, it also funded the government. If more funding isn’t offered before Dec. 28, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-23/pelosi-plans-thursday-vote-on-trump-s-2-000-stimulus-checks?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewe could see\u003c/a\u003e a government shutdown.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of yesterday, more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/23/covid-vaccine-us-has-vaccinated-1-million-people-out-of-goal-of-20-million-for-december.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1 million people\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S. have received their first dose of a Covid-19 vaccine (you can let out a “yippee” if you want). Hospital staff and nursing home workers—unquestionably “essential” in the fight against the virus—have been the initial recipients of the doses. But deciding which workers should receive the vaccines \u003cem\u003eafter\u003c/em\u003e healthcare staff is a lot more complicated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho else is “essential?” \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe definition gets murkier as workers in the delivery, manufacturing, agriculture, education, and services industries all jostle for the next wave of doses. And states that drafted their own distribution plans months ago are having trouble accommodating the CDC’s recent recommendations, which cover nearly \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vaccine-eligibilit/explainer-us-vaccine-rollouts-next-challenge-verifying-who-is-essential-idUSKBN28X1A2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e70% of the U.S. labor force\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor instance, Florida is telling the CDC to talk to the hand, deciding to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/dd86f99e-bfe0-3037-af8b-9ad236e7da66?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evaccinate seniors\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 65 or older before any other workers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewhile the order of vaccine operations remains ambiguous, one thing is clear: The U.S. wants a lot of doses. It just ordered an additional \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-pfizer/pfizer-u-s-strike-100-million-covid-19-vaccine-deal-with-70-million-due-by-june-idUSKBN28X1GC?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 million\u003c/a\u003e from Pfizer, pushing its total order of all href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/23/new-jersey-latest-state-to-join-supreme-court-battle-remote-worker-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame\u003c/a\u003e the latest state to call on the Supreme Court to take up a case over income taxes—basically, deciding which state gets your $$$. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eCertain places, like NYC and Omaha, NE, have typically welcomed a large proportion of workers who commute from \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/states-square-off-over-taxing-remote-workers-income-11608735600?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eout of state\u003c/a\u003e. Seven states levied income taxes using the “convenience rule,” which means that a New Jersey resident who works in Manhattan pays New York income taxes, but gets a credit on their NJ bill to avoid double taxation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNow, because of the pandemic, that NJ resident is probably working from home...leaving New Jersey to wonder why New York is getting all the tax revenue. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCue this actual bridge in New Jersey’s state capital, Trenton.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e  \u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTgxL3RyZW50b25fYnJpZGdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; Connecticut, Hawaii, Iowa, and now New Jersey have also sided with Team NH. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e A\u003cem\u003e lot\u003c/em\u003e of cash is at stake at a time when state coffers need it. New Jersey \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-23/new-jersey-challenges-new-york-tax-on-residents-working-remotely?utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=bd\u0026cmpId=google\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecredits\u003c/a\u003e as much as $1.2 billion in revenue to residents And we’re going to do it again for Christmas.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know what sentence is coming next: The holiday is going to look a little different this year. The AP \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/travel-brazil-italy-peru-lebanon-b7ed55cb8ba09b6295e3f078226dbcb3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erounded up\u003c/a\u003e all the different Covid restrictions people around the globe are facing this holiday season, so here’s a roundup of that roundup: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe UK: \u003c/strong\u003ePeople living in London and other areas in southeast England will be under the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/dec/23/millions-more-face-tier-4-covid-restrictions-in-england-from-boxing-day?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrictest “Tier 4” restrictions\u003c/a\u003e in order to slow the spread of a new virus variant. Tier 4 prohibits households from mixing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eItay: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom today through Dec. 27, all shops will have to close except food stores, pharmacies, and hairdressers. Newspapers are publishing colorful graphics to help people remember the rules.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLebanon: \u003c/strong\u003eThe economically struggling Middle Eastern nation is actually encouraging people to travel back to the country and spend money—it even opened nightclubs last week (but without dancing). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe U.S.: \u003c/strong\u003eThere are no specific Christmas-related Covid restrictions, however travel is expected to drop 29% this year, per AAA. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe buzzy audio social media app Clubhouse, which lets users join virtual rooms to eavesdrop on other people’s conversations, just got even buzzier. According to the NYT, it’s been testing an invite-only \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/23/style/clubhouse-app-influencers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprivate club\u003c/a\u003e called Everything in Moderation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou’re probably not invited\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: Only around 40 of the app’s most popular creators are on the list, as Clubhouse tries to keep its power users happy and navigate the age-old problem of monetization. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClubhouse, No. 14 on the App Store’s free app list, is hoping to avoid becoming the next Vine (RIP), which shut down in 2016 after 20 of its top 50 creators \u003ca href=\"https://www.mic.com/articles/157977/inside-the-secret-meeting-that-changed-the-fate-of-vine-forever?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleft the app\u003c/a\u003e a year earlier. The reason? Vine balked at the $1.2 million individual price tag the creators requested to retain them. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHistory is repeating itself. During the first meeting between users and company leadership, one Clubhouse creator asked “Where’s the money at?” per the NYT.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Everything in Moderation influencer program is the beginning of Clubhouse’s answer.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Clubhouse better figure it out quickly because the vultures are circling; Twitter has been testing out a similar voice chat room feature called \u003ca
